definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to have no other use or purpose (idiom)

sentences.english: He jazzed up the room with some bright red curtains.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些鲜红的窗帘将房间装饰得更具生气。

sentences.english: He disguised these feelings under an enormous bellowing and hurraying.
sentences.chinese: 他用大声吼叫和喝采掩饰着这些感情。

sentences.english: He faned his face with a magzine.
He swilled his room out with antiseptic.
He uses some dubious shifts to get money.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些可疑的手段去赚钱。

sentences.english: What if he used cedarwood to hide the pot smell?
sentences.chinese: 若他用香柏掩盖大麻的气味呢？

sentences.english: He makes fresh orange juice with an electric extractor.
sentences.chinese: 他用电动榨汁机榨取新鲜的橙汁。

sentences.english: He jabbed at the wild boar with his bayonet.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺刀猛刺那头野猪。

sentences.english: He covered himself with a sheet.
sentences.chinese: 他用一张床单罩住自己。

sentences.english: He spruced up the chairs with new slipcovers.
sentences.chinese: 他用新围布把椅子装扮漂亮。

sentences.english: He binds this book with leather.
The first class that morning was music. He played a tune on the violin.
sentences.chinese: 那天的第一堂课是音乐，他用小提琴演奏了一首曲子。

sentences.english: He beat time on the accelerator .
sentences.chinese: 他用脚在加速器上打拍子。
他用谈话分散她的注意力。

sentences.english: He rolled himself up in a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他用一条毯子把自己裹起来。

sentences.english: He pilled with grievous taxes and quite lost their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他用苛捐杂税剥夺百姓，失尽民心。

definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
to borrow sth for another use/to borrow an idea for one's own use
yes, that's right/variant of 似的[shi4 de5]
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
